data.title: Go for the experience!
data.text: This is a great place to step back in time. Counters with short stools, strike up a conversation with your neighbor.  Short, to the point menu, you come here for the diner/malt shop experience of the 50's and 60's. Great if you are in search of hang-over food! But family friendly as well.

data.title: Addicting burgers
data.text: Love their burgers and fries! Makes you feel like you're back in the 50's.  Very popular place in Racine and all the locals love it!

data.title: A Bit Of Nostalgia
data.text:
Kewpee's is a taste of nostalgia!
Great fun reminiscent of days gone by when there was a sofa fountain on every corner.  If you're in the mood for malts, burgers and frys this is the place for you! 
Delicious burgers made to order and served promptly hot off the grill. Generous portions. Fun, Fun, Fun!!

data.title: Great Old Burger Joint
data.text:
Not what you expect when you hear Sandwich Shop, necesssarily.  This is a burger joint.  It's an old diner themed after pretty creepy Kewpee dolls.

A great greasy burger, good fries, excellent chocolate shake.  The burger tasted familiar somehow, in a good way.  I like their very limited menu, just the basics.

Service was fairly quick.  I love the way the counter juts out into the restaurant.

data.title: Flash back and tasty
data.text: Been here a few times with the boys. Good burgers and fries.  Pass on the chicken sandwich. Wait staff are very friendly. Go early on the weekend or you'll be waiting. For a while.

data.title: So many Kewpee dolls
data.text: Went for lunch and sat at the counter. Service was great and the food was good. they make very good hamburgers and homemade root beer.

data.title: Hometown favorite
data.text: This is a local favorite. Have excellent fries, very hot, and good burgers. I also LOVE the root beer in a mug. My boyfriend always gets the chocolate malt which is also delicious.

data.title: Kewpee's an old fashioned Hamburger Joing.
data.text:
Kewpee's is like walking back into time, it has been there for ever.  Want a great experience and a great 
Hamburger?  You won't go wrong stopping in Kewpee's.

data.title: Old Style Burgers
data.text: Loved Keepers, very small restaurant with a yesteryear feel, and the food-- OUT of the WORLD delicious!  Making this a regular stop!!

data.title: The best pizza
data.text: Have know owners for years. Always good food good service good price. Take out of town guest there in addition to family. Traditional to meet there between Christmas & New Years with cousins aunts uncles & new babies.  A must go to when in Racine WI

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: An old fashioned burger place with a limited menu (burgers, chili, fries etc.) but all so good! Worth stopping just to see a little blast from the past and to sit at a counter in an old fashioned burger joint from the old days!

data.title: Original Old Fashioned Hamburger Joint !
data.text: I live in the same city and frequent Kewpee's !!  For years now, lucky me.   This establishment has been around longer than you and I and there's a reason for that.  Burgers are the best, a must try. They're moist, good flavor to the meat, soft simple bun, the right ratio of meat to bread. The price is right.  If you have room, I love the chocolate malt as well.  Bon Appetite!!

data.title: Good burgers since I don't know when
data.text:
Always the same tasty burgers, quick and friendly.  Still very fast, even at busy times.
Parking can be a problem sometimes.

data.title: Best Burger on the planet
data.text: Old franchise one of a few left a Racine tradition.  Go there you won't be disappointed.  Just a small burger joint.  No alcohol open mainly for lunch

data.title: Great local food
data.text: Great, fresh homemade burgers-simple and delicious. Limited seating, may have to wait for a table-but well with the edit.

data.title: Best burgers
data.text: These are the best burgers in Racine! And guess what???! You can even get them for breakfast! I go here every time I come home you visit family in Racine! One of the places I truly miss! It's a historic burger joint.

data.title: Quick and tasty
data.text: My burger was hot and fresh and the root beer was cold. I would have preferred the my fries to be a little bit more crispy. It's always fun to sit at the counter and talk to people sitting around you. Don't forget cash because they don't accept debit or credit and this time the ATM wasn't working.

data.title: A step back in Time
data.text: Kewpee has been around for years. I love their hamburgers and fries. Every time I go back home to visit I have to stop in. This last visit was nice I took my 23 year old son, he had never been in the restaurant. I use to just bring it home. We had root beer soda, my son stated we should've had the floats-once he seen one, oh well next time. The kewpee doll display is really neat also. The staff is great as well. I hope they will be around forever for all generations to enjoy.

data.title: Yummy Hamburgers
data.text: Best hamburgers in town, tasty fries, value pricing, but they don't accept credit cards. Old fashioned diner decor with cute Kewpee dolls, friendly/quick service. Located in Downtown Racine, near the Harbor & Reefpoing Marina. Would visit more often if they accepted credit cards.

data.title: Oh Yeah!!
data.text:
My husband read about this place somewhere and we drove an hour to check it out one rainy day.  Oh yeah, it was worth it!  I have so much to say about this place and it only has about 8 things on the menu!

Kewpee's was very busy at 12:30 and we sat at a table that had just been vacated.  A waitress came and cleaned it in short order.  We were at a six top and ended up sharing it with another couple about half way through our meal...that seems to be how it works here.  Though not from Racine, we felt very much like we were part of the Kewpee family from the moment we entered.  Had a great chat with a 90 year old WWII vet who stopped by our table!  I also was reminded of a favorite cafe from childhood...this place had such a great vibe and I would highly recommend it!!

There is table seating and counter seating.  There is a whole wall of Kewpie dolls behind glass.  There is only the menu on the wall.  They have some breakfast items, burgers, chicken, fish, and toasted cheese sandwiches.  Fries and some other sides.  We had cheese burgers and split a toasted cheese--really yummy!  The root beer is amazing and you get free refills!!  The shakes looked amazing, too!  The wait staff is beyond nice and efficient.  The prices are super reasonable!  The owner was on the grill.  They have $13 t-shirts for heaves sake!  What's not to love!
